image.altText: The exterior of the Port Adelaide Police Station.

props.synopsis: SA Police says the sudden death at Port Adelaide Police Station on Monday afternoon is not thought to be suspicious, but will be subject to a coronial investigation and a Commissioner's inquiry.Â

title.children: Inquiry launched after female police officer found dead at Port Adelaide station

image.altText: A close up of an older woman wearing a black chef's hat and apron reading 'Nonna's Cucina'

props.synopsis: A 91-year-old Adelaide man accused of murdering his wife, Maria Dimasi, at their suburban home in December, is excused from his court hearing after a magistrate heard he is suffering from illness.

title.children: Elderly man accused of murdering wife excused from court due to infection and delirium

image.altText: Drone footage shows extent of flooding in Rochester

props.synopsis: Residents in flood-affected Victorian towns face an anxious wait to see the extent of the damage after waters peaked overnight and this morning. Follow our live coverage.

title.children: Drone vision shows extent of flooding in regional Victorian towns as premier flags 'tough recovery'

image.altText: A close up of the damaged surface of a spacecraft as it floats through space.

props.synopsis: A private company's Peregrine lander appears unlikely to complete its original mission after running into issues on its way to the Moon.

title.children: The first US Moon landing in more than 50 years has hit a major hurdle after a 'critical' fuel leak

image.altText: A screen showing all southern Tasmanian ambulance crews and where they are, including 8 ramped at Royal Hobart Hospital

props.synopsis: A screenshot of a dispatch system showing all ambulances either ramped or otherwise unavailable is presented by a union as further evidence of the worsening "crisis" in southern Tasmania's health system.

title.children: Half of Tasmania was without an available ambulance on Monday afternoon and this image shows why, union says

image.altText: General view of Rod Laver Arena

props.synopsis: The Australian Open has shone a spotlight on Australia as a nation for decades, showing the changing face of Australians and our place in the world. It has, however,Â not always revealed a pretty picture.

title.children: Ecuador under state of emergency after powerful drug lord 'Fito' escapes maximum security jail

image.altText: A massive pickup truck tows a caravan along a narrow bridge in an urban area.

props.synopsis: Australia has a big car habit, and those cars often cause more road damage, pollute more and pose greater road safety risks. But advocates for reform say current tax laws actually incentivise Australians to buy big.

title.children: Australians have ditched the sedan for the SUV. Should government intervene to reverse the trend?

image.altText: A signpost is underwater as flooding takes over the parklands

title.children: Flash flooding has water 'lapping' at doors west of Brisbane, as over 130mm of rain falls in three hours

image.altText: A man wearing a red shirt and blue jacket standing in front of a leafy background, smiling

props.synopsis: Hours after replying to a message he thought was from Australia Post, fraudsters were spending his money at a local store. He says his experience with the bank and police left him feeling defeated.

title.children: Jonathan's bank transactions show exactly where scammers used his details. But neither his bank nor the police offered help

image.altText: People shopping in the Queen Street mall in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: The ASX is trading strongly higher after Wall Street's positive session overnight, and further boosted by a much bigger than expected jump in November retail sales. Follow live.

title.children: Black Friday sales surge, ASX jumps after Wall Street's tech-heavy rally

image.altText: A spectacular view of Sydney Harbour shows the Opera House and Harbour Bridge illuminated by golden fireworks.

props.synopsis: We were all wishing each other a happy new year last week. But will it really be in an economic sense, or will most Australians continue to struggle?

title.children: Australians are likely to see falling inflation, interest rates and taxes this year, but there's also a 'high risk' of recession

image.altText: A man in a red soccer shirt holding up a purple cocktail

props.synopsis: Tony Eccleston went to an Adelaide hospital for a suspected blood clot and after nine hours in the waiting room, he died.

title.children: Widow questions if ambulance patients were prioritised over husband who died waiting hours in hospital

image.altText: A woman in a winter coat and glasses.

props.synopsis: A woman accused of murdering her elderly parents by allegedly injecting them with her own medication has been remanded in custody after allegedly breaching her bail conditions on five occasions.

title.children: Woman accused of murdering elderly parents allegedly breaches bail by 'strolling around' shopping centre

image.altText: An empty beach leads to a heavy industrial area with large smoke plumes

props.synopsis: Around 1,000 workers are set to lose their jobs as Alcoa announces it will phase down production at its alumina refinery in Perth's south.

title.children: Around 1,000 workers to lose jobs as Alcoa moves to shut alumina refinery in Perth's south

image.altText: A court sketch of Wayne LaPierre (wearing glasses and black tie) and John Frazer (wearing glasses and maroon tie).

props.synopsis: New York Attorney-General Letitia James had sued the NRA and its longtime leader in August 2020, saying the group diverted millions of dollars to fund luxuries for top officials, including travel expenses for Mr LaPierre to several resorts.Â

title.children: NRA boss turned gun rights group into 'Wayne's World', lawyer says at New York corruption trial

image.altText: Two soldiers stand by a white shipping container as a large vehicle fires in a flash of smoke and flame behind them.

props.synopsis: It comes as US Secretary of State Antony Blinken continues his tour of the Middle East, seeking to kickstart concerted peace efforts he says are necessary to prevent the violence from spreading to the wider region.

title.children: Israel kills senior Hezbollah commander in 'painful strike' on southern Lebanon

image.altText: A wide shot of a Boeing 737 Max 9 airliner with United Airlines branding landing at an airport

props.synopsis: United and Alaska Airlines have both reported loose hardware had been discovered on some of their Boeing 737 MAX9 planes during preliminary inspections after a dramatic mid-flight incident last week.

title.children: United, Alaska Airlines find loose bolts on grounded Boeing 737 MAX 9 jetliners

image.altText: Footage shows a shark pithing

props.synopsis: Sandy golden beaches are a tourism jackpot for the Sunshine State, and the Queensland government literally kills to keep it that way.

title.children: Tiger shark stabbed in the head, heart removed to keep swimmers safe at Queensland beaches

image.altText: An ensemble of recorder players perform the ABC news theme.

props.synopsis: The unsung hero of the baroque world, and the bane of parents across the country, has a welcoming home at the Australasian Recorder Festival this week.

title.children: From Hot Cross Buns to Handel, NSW festival proves the recorder is more than a noisemaker for school kids

props.synopsis: NSW reports more than the average number of patients presenting with mycoplasma pneumonia for this time of year.

image.altText: A woman in a seafoam green veil gives a peace sign

props.synopsis: Once a pro-democracy icon, Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has won a fifth term in Bangladesh. But her critics say she's taking the country down a dangerous path.

title.children: How the iron lady of Bangladesh just tightened her grip on power

image.altText: A group of MNDAA soldiers pose for a photo with three captured enemies.

props.synopsis: Myanmar's military government cedes control of the capital of the self-administered Kokang region in the country's north-east, the most significant defeat for the junta since an alliance of three ethnic-based rebel armies launched an offensive on October 27.Â

title.children: 'Defeat after defeat': Ruling junta surrenders regional capital in Myanmar's north-east

image.altText: A man holds a credit card while using a laptop

props.synopsis: Complaints about scams to Australia's financial dispute resolution scheme nearly double in one year, amid warnings it is putting "unnecessary pressure" on the independent umpire.

title.children: Warnings 'unsustainable' surge in complaints about banks will create delays for consumers

image.altText: Bald man in a black suit holding up a microphone on stage

props.synopsis: The comedian says he took on a job no-one wanted and that "there wasn't enough time to prepare".

image.altText: Da'Vine Joy Randolph on the set of the Holdovers

title.children: 'I do my job best when how I look doesn't matter': Da'Vine Joy Randolph shines in Golden-Globe winning role

image.altText: A film still of Jamael Westman, Himesh Patel, Ruth Negga and Daniel Levy, sitting close together on a couch, smiling.

props.synopsis: The directorial debut of Schitt's Creek creator and star Dan Levy sees the actor's character Marc navigating the stormy waters of grief, with help from his friends.

title.children: Calling all Schitt's Creek fans: Dan Levy's new movie might just break your heart

image.altText: A photograph of James Dalamangas next to an impression of how he looks 25 years on.

title.children: Time's running out to find one of Australia's most wanted men believed to be in Greece after fatal stabbing

image.altText: Ants eating sugar crystals on a white table

props.synopsis: Warmer temperatures are often synonymous with the smell of sunscreen and longer evenings spent outdoors. But in southern parts of Australia, a sure-fire indicator that the weather is heating up is the appearance of those tiny little ants trailing through your kitchen. So how can you deal with them?

title.children: Why is my home swarming with tiny ants, and what can I do about it?

image.altText: Aircrete Dome Elysian Falls painted and awaiting final touches

props.synopsis: Balancing energy ultimately makes the difference for those looking to live outside the system according to one woman who has done it, but is going off-grid really the best thing for the planet?
